name: The Westin Stonebriar

reviews.text: I can say that generally Westin are my first choice when I travel to an area I am unfamiliar with however this particular Westin seemed to be a little worn around the edges. Maybe it's the age of the hotel but in particular the furnishings seemed to be worn more than most Westin's I've stayed at previously. For instance the lamp shade on my desk had been taped together from the inside and since broken open. The service could not have been better both at check in and the room service as well but the furnishings just didn't seem up to the Westin standards I am used to seeing in their hotels.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but a little worn around the edges.

reviews.text: I completed the menu card and requested my breakfast be delivered between 6:45 am - 7:00 am. I called at 7:01 am to check on my order. The operator indicated it was enroute, but offered no apologies for the delay. Her response to me was that I had to keep in mind that I was not the only guest awaiting room service. When my order arrived, the delivery person emphasized that she was only three minutes late...again, no apology. At that time, the hotel offered to charge me half of the tab. Once I sat down to eat, I realized my order was not complete. I spoke to the main deskperson about the incident, adding that not only was my delivery late but incomplete, as well. She still charged me half of the meal. My thought was, well, I hope it was worth losing a potentially frequent customer over $13.00.
reviews.title: Customer Service Needs Improvement.

reviews.text: I had a very unsatisfactory stay at this property last month, but decided to try it again because the general manager took the time to discuss my concerns. It is so hard to find places where management really does care and follows through on guest comments. I am very happy I gave this property another chance.
reviews.title: 360 degree turnaround

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked in on a Friday evening for a two night stay. I used a Starwood free weekend promotion pass for one night. The room I stayed in was a deluxe suite on the second floor. I am probably overly sensitive to noise, and was concerned when I saw the room was near to an elevator, but noise was not a problem during our stay. The room was very clean and the problems I had in the last room at the property where things looked dated weren't a problem in this room. I hate when I stay in hotels and there is one bar of soap for the shower, separate bath, and sink area; this was not a problem here. Housekeeping left ample soap and towels for my stay. The dual head shower fixture was so nice. The heavenly bed was very comfortable and I had a great sleep both nights.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: When I made my reservation for the free night at the spg site I mentioned it was my birthday. The hotel left a nice note and some bubbly in the room and I very much appreciated that.
reviews.title: Outstanding - one of the best Westin's

reviews.text: Very nice Westin resort but missing some of the business amenities I expect. Only certain rooms have limited mini bar. Desk is not a great work station. Excellent staff makes up for the minor misses. The hotel could use a mid-cycle freshen up but the rooms are kept very clean. I would definately recommend this hotel for the area.
reviews.title: Very nice resort Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and I use this hotel as our "take a break" place. We are from Fort Worth, but I attended a conference here once and was impressed. It is a great place to go for a quick night out. We lover the pool area. Big, long pool with lots of loungers. Great place o bring a book and spend all day. In Texas summers, yo can read for an hour, then jump in the pool. The pool itself has lots of "shelfs" so you can sit and relax, read or talk. I slide for kids to just keep things interesting.
reviews.title: Getaway to Relax

likes.liked: — Relaxing at the great pool area

reviews.text: The rooms are big and comfortable. Overlooks the golf course and/or Dallas (far away). The Westin beds are the best in the hotel world and there seems there are 100's of pillow. Bathroom is great.
reviews.title: Best service in Texas

reviews.text: Decor is modern sothwest - lots of stone, tile and wood. Check-in can be little slow if busy. They have the new style lobby with small stations and you can get confused on where to stand when there is a line.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The Grill is very good for breakfast. Sunday brunch is awesome. Dinner is OK. This is a more of a business/meeting hotel so usually not very crowded on the weekends. I think that hurts the food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Superb Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed her for the weekend for my sisters wedding. I can't really comment on the location since I was only there for the wedding but it feel a little out of the way. The rooms were nice and large and also had good bathrooms. The design was very country and Texas but it worked and felt like a resort because of that. Great golf course on property and the pool area was nice as well. The restaurant and bar were great too. Gym was amazing and free. Wouldn't stay there if I wanted to be close to Dallas but for a relaxing weekend it was fine. Easy drive form DFW as well.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean like every Westin

reviews.text: Resort accomodations are first class. Stayed here on biz with other employees and was impressed with the whole facility. Unlike many 'resorts" parking is short walk as well as many dining and shopping. This is really a suprise considering it is a golf resort and has many other amenities associated with properties that are ussually located in the middle of nowhere. Also while walking the property I was very impressed that the GM was frequently in the lobby asking how are stay was or if we needed any assistance. We did not eat at the hotel, but we did try out the bar... which was very "perfect" Overall I would recommend this especially at the very fair rate at which we paid.
reviews.title: Nice resort close to many dining, entertainment and shopping options

reviews.text: We went to the Westin Stonebriar for a Spring Break getaway. The lagoon pool with a slide and waterfalls was awesome. The rooms were so comfortable with a balcony door, comfy beds and nice bathrooms. From the time we got there were treated very well. It couldn't have been any better. It's sort of in a country setting but less than 5 min to the Stonebriar Mall. We'll definately be back!
reviews.title: Best Stay Ever...

reviews.text: The Westin Stonebriar was great! The rooms were nice, the beds were comfortable and the service was outstanding. The meeting facilities were perfect for a company meeting. The fitness center was one of the nicest I have seen in a hotel; it was gym quality. I hope my company meeting is here again next year.
reviews.title: I would stay here again

reviews.text: Unfortunately the weekend I went there it was FREEZING! But here's my review
reviews.title: It was alright...

likes.disliked: — Wondering about extra charges not listed on bill

reviews.text: If you are interested in your neighbors tv viewing habits or night time conversations, this may be for you. If you want a good night sleep, look elsewhere. If nothing wakes you and you can fall asleep at the drop of a hat, then you may be okay.
reviews.title: light sleepers beware - paper thin walls

reviews.text: I am surprised that I've never posted a review on the Westen Stonebriar! We make a point to stay there several times a year.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment one is greeted by the Valet, whether you're a weary traveler or a giddy couple looking for a romantic weekend, you will be made to feel you are a VIP at the Westin Stonebriar. We open the door to our room and a wave of comfortable elegance envelopes our senses. We have been known to check in and not leave the grounds for days on end. The Heavenly beds are indeed heavenly, and the lagoon pool makes for a perfect lazy day of relaxation.
reviews.title: Excellent Mini Vacation!

reviews.text: The staff is always warm and friendly, making a point to recognize repeat guests time after time. Front desk makes every effort to accomodate guests with requests made, room service is always timely and courteous.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel and had a great offer.

reviews.text: Rack rates may sometimes seem pricey, but if you are flexible with your dates fabulous deals can be found.
reviews.title: Relaxing in upscale area of Dallas

description: Located in the North Dallas suburb of Frisco, The Westin Stonebriar offers a rejuvenating haven away from the rigors of travel.
